comment: She understands the subject very well, and she is very understanding. She does not give much homework ,and her tests are pretty straightforward. She is a wonderful person and teacher.

You will not find a more passionate professor who teaches Physical Activity. She is so clear, enthusiastic, and knowledgeable about this course. On top of that, she gives 100% everyday and has a bright and positive attitude. She cares so much about her students and wants us to do well. She is so nice and has such a kind heart.

Frederick is pretty easy, she doesn't ask for much. But she does like to give random quizzes called retrieval practices. SHE DOESN'T LET YOU GO BACK TO PREVIOUS QUESTIONS ON QUIZZES OR TESTS. That's the only major problem. The class is kinda boring and if you don't want to go just make sure to look over the powerpoints to catch up a little bit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Let's be real here.  She has a deep passion for this course and goes into specific detail into every little fact.  Her lectures are super long because she talks the ENTIRE, and I mean ENTIRE time.  All of her students zone out. But she is helpful, nice and young.  Class is so easy if you do all your work and study for tests.  A lot of common sense.

CLASS TAKEN: Wellness  LECTURES: Lots of reading on each chapter. Took online, no lectures.   HOMEWORK: Via online through bearface. Program was a bit confusing, but not a lot of hw.   GRADING: Easy Grader   TESTS/QUIZES: None.
She is just amazing Make sure she knows you  If you really listen carefully you'll know what the exam questions are,  the review is not exactly but 90% the questions to be asked on the test

Projects and chapters are pretty easy. Lots of work but she gives about 2 weeks per chapter so...you have time. Does not take late work so, get it done! She also curves. I ended up with a 88.6% in the class....but got a 90% (A). Thanks. Online class but she kept in contact and up with emails. Good job.

Online class was easy. She grades very fairly. However there is large workload and you will need to read each chapter in the ebook to pass the tests. There are a few discussions and projects throughout. CTQs, labs, and a test are the main things in each module. Easy A as long as you do your work.
I took her class online. Although I didn't like the online book but the work was fairly easy. Slightly a large load of work but you ate given enough time to complete the work plus grace periods.
